segmentos.text: SPEAKER_11: ERA International (HK) Ltd. Presents
SPEAKER_11: In Association with Shanghai Film Studios
SPEAKER_11: Producer: Chiu Fusheng

SPEAKER_11: Executive Producers:
Kow Fuhong and Christopher Tseng
SPEAKER_11: Associate Producer: Barbara Robinson
SPEAKER_11: Adaptation from Yu Hua's novel
SPEAKER_11: TO LIVE
SPEAKER_11: Script: Yu Hua and Lu Wei
SPEAKER_11: Screenplay: Lu Wei
SPEAKER_11: Director of Photography: Lu Yue
SPEAKER_11: Art Direction: Cao Jiuping
SPEAKER_11: Sound: Tao Jiping
SPEAKER_11: Music: Zhao Jiping
SPEAKER_11: Editor: Du Yuan

SPEAKER_11: Starring:
Ge You - Gong Li
SPEAKER_11: Directed by Zhang Yimou
SPEAKER_11: The 1940s
SPEAKER_11: I have nothing left.
SPEAKER_11: Needles and threads for sale!
SPEAKER_11: One, two, three. One, two, three.
SPEAKER_11: Chunsheng!
SPEAKER_11: Take that!

SPEAKER_11: - Enough?
- No!
SPEAKER_11: Enough?
SPEAKER_11: Still not enough? Okay, I'll fill it right up.

SPEAKER_11: Look at all the chili sauce.
Let me see your eyes.
SPEAKER_11: Don't hit him!
SPEAKER_11: Enough?

SPEAKER_11: June 1966: Start of the
"Great Proletarian Cultural Revolution."
SPEAKER_11: Sit here.
SPEAKER_11: You have to get rid of those puppets.
SPEAKER_11: Clear a path! Ship sailing through!
SPEAKER_11: Let's get the whole family.

SPEAKER_11: The ship of revolution! Advance
through the storm with Chairman Mao!
SPEAKER_11: Come over here.
SPEAKER_11: Now, bow!
SPEAKER_11: Go on, don't be sad.
SPEAKER_11: You'll be back!
SPEAKER_11: Fengxia! Mommy's here. Don't be afraid.
SPEAKER_11: Some years later...
SPEAKER_15: You've lost again.
SPEAKER_15: Not one lucky toss all night.
SPEAKER_15: Long'er, you're nearly there.
SPEAKER_15: One more night like this...
SPEAKER_15: you'll have him right where you want him.
SPEAKER_15: Sure there's no mistake?
SPEAKER_15: Look at the records.
SPEAKER_15: Your win, Master Fugui.
SPEAKER_15: Master Fugui, your wife's here.
SPEAKER_15: What are you doing here?
SPEAKER_15: Well?
SPEAKER_15: Master Fugui, you lost.
SPEAKER_15: Let's roll!
SPEAKER_15: Master Fugui.
SPEAKER_15: Well?
SPEAKER_15: Master Fugui, you're out of the game.

SPEAKER_15: You bet your property.
It's equal to what you owe Long'er.
SPEAKER_15: You don't have a roof tile to your name.
SPEAKER_15: What is it?
SPEAKER_15: Master Fugui must settle his account.
SPEAKER_15: Good.
SPEAKER_15: Chunsheng.
SPEAKER_15: Okay.
SPEAKER_05: Chalk it up.
SPEAKER_05: How much?
SPEAKER_05: But my calligraphy's improving.
SPEAKER_05: Long'er, you neglect your troupe.
SPEAKER_05: Don't cry.
SPEAKER_05: It's not good for the baby.
SPEAKER_05: Let me wipe your tears.
SPEAKER_05: All right, do it yourself. But please don't cry.
SPEAKER_05: Fugui...
SPEAKER_05: My luck's changed.
SPEAKER_05: Write that down. Another round.
SPEAKER_05: Go home, go.
SPEAKER_05: It's settled.
SPEAKER_05: You've lost everything.
SPEAKER_05: What do you mean?
SPEAKER_05: You can't just win and walk away.
SPEAKER_05: The game's not over yet!
SPEAKER_05: We'll formalize the transfer in a few days...
SPEAKER_05: and explain to your old man.
SPEAKER_05: Okay?
SPEAKER_05: Master Fugui, I'll take you.
SPEAKER_05: Mother's feeling better.
SPEAKER_05: Normally she doesn't even get out of bed.
SPEAKER_05: Just call me Fugui.
SPEAKER_05: "Don't Gamble" is my son's name.
SPEAKER_05: You mocking me?
SPEAKER_05: No, his real name's Youqing.
SPEAKER_05: Jiazhen came back with him.
SPEAKER_05: We almost called him "Don't Gamble."
SPEAKER_05: I'd like to borrow money to set up a shop.
SPEAKER_05: As for me...
SPEAKER_05: I want to live. There's nothing like family.
SPEAKER_05: It really is booze!
SPEAKER_05: They won't shoot us?
SPEAKER_05: Not as long as you've got your hands up.
SPEAKER_05: And live a good life.
SPEAKER_05: Fengxia!
SPEAKER_05: It's your daddy.
SPEAKER_05: What are you doing?
SPEAKER_05: Where's mommy?
SPEAKER_05: we sang for the Liberation Army.
SPEAKER_05: Suppose I was singing for her, too.
SPEAKER_05: I thought of you...
SPEAKER_05: How come Fengxia can't talk?
SPEAKER_05: She was fine when I left.
SPEAKER_05: She can't even say "Daddy."
SPEAKER_05: Fugui's back.
SPEAKER_05: This is our town leader, Mr. Niu.
SPEAKER_05: Five bullets. Five.
SPEAKER_05: They shot him.
SPEAKER_05: Pumped five bullets into him.
SPEAKER_05: He is dead.
SPEAKER_05: If I hadn't lost my home to him...
SPEAKER_05: that'd have been me.

SPEAKER_05: Sounds okay to me.
And I took part in the revolution.

SPEAKER_05: - What are you looking for?
- That certificate.
SPEAKER_05: Better dry it out fast.
SPEAKER_05: It's good to be poor. Nothing like it.
SPEAKER_05: You can leave those.
SPEAKER_05: We won't touch them.
SPEAKER_05: We're off to the next house.
SPEAKER_05: Daddy will make it better.
SPEAKER_05: Youqing, after dinner...
SPEAKER_05: come see the show.
SPEAKER_05: Youqing's not going to any stupid show.
SPEAKER_05: He uses the secret mirror
SPEAKER_05: and blinds all who look within
SPEAKER_05: I yell there's no time to waste
SPEAKER_05: Far away, we flee with haste
SPEAKER_05: Jiazhen, where's Youqing?

SPEAKER_05: There'll be dumplings
at the canteen tonight...
SPEAKER_05: They'll all go to Taiwan!

SPEAKER_05: He won't be able to sleep or eat
or ever take a dump...
SPEAKER_05: and we'll liberate Taiwan!
SPEAKER_05: Pack a lunchbox. I'll wake him.
SPEAKER_05: Youqing, wake up. We're nearly there.
SPEAKER_05: When you get there...
SPEAKER_05: put your dumplings in hot water.
SPEAKER_05: Make sure you make them hot enough.
SPEAKER_05: Cold dumplings are bad for the tummy.

SPEAKER_05: - Do you like dumplings?
- Yes.

SPEAKER_05: - Do you like meat?
- Yes.
SPEAKER_05: That's good.
SPEAKER_05: If Youqing does as daddy says...
SPEAKER_05: our lives will get better and better.
SPEAKER_05: Our family...
SPEAKER_05: is like a little chicken.
SPEAKER_05: When it grows up, it becomes a goose.
SPEAKER_05: And that'll turn into a sheep.
SPEAKER_05: The sheep will turn into an ox.
SPEAKER_05: After the ox is Communism.

SPEAKER_05: And there'll be dumplings and meat
every day.
SPEAKER_05: You're the District Chief?
SPEAKER_05: It was you who killed my son?
SPEAKER_05: I had only one son, Chunsheng!
SPEAKER_05: And you killed him!

SPEAKER_05: - You're eating?
- Come on in, Mr. Niu.

SPEAKER_05: - Don't let me interrupt.
- We're finished.
SPEAKER_05: He'd like to meet her.
SPEAKER_05: Sounds too good. Will he go for Fengxia?
SPEAKER_05: He's also got a handicap...
SPEAKER_05: You won't stay?
SPEAKER_05: From where?
SPEAKER_05: You're just in time. We've just finished.
SPEAKER_05: "The working class leads us all."
SPEAKER_05: Erxi is good with his hands.

SPEAKER_05: He painted all the Chairman Maos
in our factory!
SPEAKER_05: We're happy if you are.
SPEAKER_05: Anytime. You decide.
SPEAKER_05: begin their wedded life.
SPEAKER_05: In good times, we think of Chairman Mao.
SPEAKER_05: Let's sing a song!

SPEAKER_05: Nothing compares
to the Party's benevolence

SPEAKER_05: Chairman Mao is dearer
than father and mother
SPEAKER_05: There's nothing as good as socialism
SPEAKER_05: No ocean as deep as class feeling

SPEAKER_05: Maoist Thought
is revolution's treasure trove
SPEAKER_05: Whoever opposes it, we take as our enemy
SPEAKER_05: Come on, you can't cry today.
SPEAKER_05: Come on inside.
SPEAKER_05: Jiazhen, make some tea.
SPEAKER_05: Sit with us for a bit.
SPEAKER_05: Don't be like that.
SPEAKER_05: Come as soon as the water's ready.
SPEAKER_05: But here's boiled water.
SPEAKER_05: Chunsheng came to wish Fengxia well.
SPEAKER_05: You can't go on avoiding him.
SPEAKER_05: Can't we put this behind us?
SPEAKER_05: But it's Chairman Mao.
SPEAKER_05: Dad! Mom!
SPEAKER_05: On the mend.
SPEAKER_05: Better when you come over.
SPEAKER_05: Help me with the table.
SPEAKER_05: No wonder there's a bottle!
SPEAKER_05: Cheers!
SPEAKER_05: Don't bring up the past.
SPEAKER_05: I was a real no-hoper.
SPEAKER_05: But things are better now.
SPEAKER_05: And will be better for your child.
SPEAKER_05: This is great.
SPEAKER_05: Of course.
SPEAKER_05: There's always been a line.
SPEAKER_05: Haven't had much to do with him for years.
SPEAKER_05: It'll just take a minute.
SPEAKER_05: It's all in this account. Take it.
SPEAKER_05: You came for this?
SPEAKER_05: All my debts will have been paid.
SPEAKER_05: What do you mean?
SPEAKER_05: Killed herself?
SPEAKER_05: Why?
SPEAKER_05: I don't know.
SPEAKER_05: Have you seen her body?
SPEAKER_05: You mustn't lose hope.
SPEAKER_05: Don't go getting any stupid ideas.
SPEAKER_05: You must bear it, no matter what!
SPEAKER_05: You can't take that road yourself.
SPEAKER_05: I don't want to live anymore!
SPEAKER_05: Let's say we accept this money.
SPEAKER_05: Keep it for us. There's plenty of time.
SPEAKER_05: I know how difficult it must be...
SPEAKER_05: but you've got to pull through...
SPEAKER_05: you've got to bear it!
SPEAKER_05: Yes, come in.
SPEAKER_05: No, thank you, I've got to go.
SPEAKER_05: Time does fly!
SPEAKER_05: Erxi sent word from the hospital.
SPEAKER_05: She's in labor. We're on our way there.
SPEAKER_05: Another working class member on the way!
SPEAKER_05: So we've got to get going.
SPEAKER_05: Everyone knows you.
SPEAKER_05: No, it's better if I wear it.
SPEAKER_05: Let me wear it!
SPEAKER_05: I'm just going to see him.
SPEAKER_05: He's all right.
SPEAKER_05: How's Fengxia?
SPEAKER_05: Take your time. There's plenty.
SPEAKER_05: What name do you like?
SPEAKER_05: Can we see them?
SPEAKER_05: Please, comrade, just one peek?
SPEAKER_05: Why'd he do that?

SPEAKER_05: He's been locked up without food.
He scoffed those buns.
SPEAKER_05: Drink it slowly.
SPEAKER_05: Help us!
SPEAKER_05: She's bleeding! We don't know what to do.
SPEAKER_05: Quick!
SPEAKER_05: Is it?
SPEAKER_05: I'll fix it.
SPEAKER_05: Have you had your medicine?
SPEAKER_05: I'll make lunch.
SPEAKER_05: Little Bun...
SPEAKER_05: Are you happy?
SPEAKER_05: Where will they live?
SPEAKER_05: I'll find a home for them when we get back.
SPEAKER_05: If I hadn't given Dr. Wang those buns...
SPEAKER_05: everything would've been fine.
SPEAKER_05: How about in here?
SPEAKER_05: This box is bigger, isn't it?
SPEAKER_05: They'll have more room to run around.
SPEAKER_05: Then they'll eat more.
SPEAKER_05: And soon they'll grow up.
SPEAKER_05: And then...
SPEAKER_05: the chickens will turn into geese...
SPEAKER_05: and the geese will turn into sheep...
SPEAKER_05: and the sheep will turn into oxen.
SPEAKER_05: Little Bun won't ride on an ox...
SPEAKER_19: Chunsheng.
SPEAKER_19: I've run up a pile of debts lately.

SPEAKER_19: Mr. Long'er says
if you're busy he'll take a rain check.
SPEAKER_19: Might never go home again.
SPEAKER_19: What are you looking at?
SPEAKER_19: Thinking of escaping?
SPEAKER_19: The Nationalists will shoot you.
SPEAKER_19: I'd die happy if I could drive.
SPEAKER_19: Lao Quan, have a drink.
SPEAKER_19: What?

SPEAKER_19: - Shouldn't we run, too?
- Where to?
SPEAKER_19: This will do the trick?

SPEAKER_19: - The attack hasn't started.
- Let's put them down.
SPEAKER_19: I meant to call...
SPEAKER_19: after I settled in.
SPEAKER_19: Fugui...
SPEAKER_19: how could it be your son?
SPEAKER_19: Take this for now.
SPEAKER_19: It's money.
SPEAKER_19: Tell me what else I can do.
SPEAKER_19: I owe you a life.
SPEAKER_19: I will remember.
SPEAKER_19: I'll be going.
SPEAKER_19: Dad, Mom...
SPEAKER_19: Congratulations on Fengxia's wedding.

SPEAKER_19: - When did you get here?
- A while ago.

SPEAKER_19: But there were so many people,
I didn't come in.
SPEAKER_19: I'll be going.
SPEAKER_19: Don't go. The tea's ready.
SPEAKER_19: Never mind.
SPEAKER_19: Jiazhen, I know you don't want to see me.
SPEAKER_19: I'll leave my gift here and be gone.
SPEAKER_19: Fugui!
SPEAKER_19: Who's there?
SPEAKER_19: Chunsheng.
SPEAKER_19: Who?
SPEAKER_19: Chunsheng.
SPEAKER_19: What do you want?
SPEAKER_19: Come out for a second.
SPEAKER_19: Well?
SPEAKER_19: Fugui...
SPEAKER_19: I've always felt terrible about Youqing.

SPEAKER_19: I've often tried to give you money.
You'd never accept it.
SPEAKER_19: Take this...
SPEAKER_19: and my heart will be at ease.
SPEAKER_19: Yesterday, my wife killed herself.
SPEAKER_19: No.
SPEAKER_19: I just got an official notice.
SPEAKER_19: I don't think I can.
SPEAKER_19: I snuck out just now...
SPEAKER_19: and better get back.
SPEAKER_19: Chunsheng, remember...

SPEAKER_04: But not my money.
They sound like a pack of mules.
SPEAKER_04: They're too tired. Been at it all night.
SPEAKER_04: Little bastards from big bastards grow.
SPEAKER_04: I learned all I know from you.

SPEAKER_04: How do you think we lost
most of what we had in the first place?

SPEAKER_04: You're the one they call big bastard, Xu,
not me!

SPEAKER_04: Mother, when you finish,
send him to his room.
SPEAKER_04: He's just singing to himself.
SPEAKER_04: You're up.
SPEAKER_04: What's wrong?
SPEAKER_04: Can't rush these things.
SPEAKER_04: Fengxia's growing up. Another's on the way.
SPEAKER_04: No, have him wait. I'll be right there.
SPEAKER_04: This is the last time, okay? I promise.
SPEAKER_04: get a rickshaw to take my wife home. I'm...

SPEAKER_04: It's just a bunch of puppets.
Get rid of them! This is war!
SPEAKER_04: They're not mine. It's how I make my living.
SPEAKER_04: What happened? No one's left?
SPEAKER_04: How?

SPEAKER_04: - On one of the wounded.
- It's a killing field.
SPEAKER_04: I just dragged a cannon and sang opera.
SPEAKER_04: What class do we belong to?
SPEAKER_04: Landlords?

SPEAKER_04: Surely not. We lost that status to Long'er.
So, what are we?
SPEAKER_04: they captured two mountains a day.
SPEAKER_04: This hasn't anything to do with us adults.
SPEAKER_04: We don't know what's going on.
SPEAKER_04: Do you expect me to believe that?

SPEAKER_04: - Are you going?
- No.

SPEAKER_04: - Are you going or not?
- No!

SPEAKER_04: - I'm telling you to go!
- No!
SPEAKER_04: Said he was a saboteur. I had to.
SPEAKER_04: Why wouldn't he just apologize?
SPEAKER_04: I hit him for not obeying.
SPEAKER_04: That's no excuse.
SPEAKER_04: You spoil him.
SPEAKER_04: How so?
SPEAKER_04: Can't you see I'm doing this for our family?
SPEAKER_04: Don't you understand?
SPEAKER_04: If you indulge him, we'll all go to ruin.
SPEAKER_04: I'll hit him again if I have to.
SPEAKER_04: Sit then. Right in front of me!
SPEAKER_04: Ask him again.
SPEAKER_04: Say I want him to.
SPEAKER_04: Youqing, is that tea for me?
SPEAKER_04: Good boy, bring it over here.
SPEAKER_04: Daddy.
SPEAKER_04: How do you like my singing?
SPEAKER_04: You little bastard! I'll break your legs!
SPEAKER_04: Xia, Youqing, have some dumplings.
SPEAKER_04: I had only one son!
SPEAKER_04: Have some lunch first.
SPEAKER_04: No, really.
SPEAKER_04: Anything is possible.
SPEAKER_04: Mr. Niu said he was a Red Guard.

SPEAKER_04: - Don't rush off!
- I'll make you something to eat.
SPEAKER_04: Do stay! Come on inside.
SPEAKER_04: Erxi painted this.
SPEAKER_04: At least it's loud enough for her to hear.
SPEAKER_04: Isn't the tea ready yet?
SPEAKER_04: Chunsheng's been here for ages.
SPEAKER_04: Just say what you want.
SPEAKER_04: You, a capitalist?
SPEAKER_04: Niu, don't let it get to you. Take care!
SPEAKER_04: Okay, we're going.

SPEAKER_04: - Sorry for the trouble.
- It's our job.
SPEAKER_04: Where's Erxi?

SPEAKER_04: - Already?
- We didn't hear a sound.
SPEAKER_04: We'll see them soon.
SPEAKER_04: Did he eat all seven buns?
SPEAKER_04: Yes, just gobbled them up.
SPEAKER_04: Careful, it's hot.
SPEAKER_04: Wouldn't Dr. Wang know?
SPEAKER_04: He's eaten too much.
SPEAKER_04: What do you mean?
SPEAKER_04: Take the medicine to Granny.

SPEAKER_01: Why don't you have a go?
Show them what it takes.
SPEAKER_01: Business is good, Mr. Xie.

SPEAKER_01: Why don't you go home?
There'll be other times.
SPEAKER_01: Your wife is right here.

SPEAKER_01: What's with you?
Can't take "no" for an answer?
SPEAKER_01: You want to make me lose face? Go away!
SPEAKER_01: It's all in order, I'll be going.
SPEAKER_01: Master Fugui, don't think badly of me...
SPEAKER_01: for leaving you homeless.
SPEAKER_01: But I sure like that mansion of yours.
SPEAKER_01: See you there in a few days.
SPEAKER_01: Master Fugui, I'm sorry...

SPEAKER_01: but you've nothing left.
What would you wager?
SPEAKER_01: Careful, slowly. Don't move too fast!
SPEAKER_01: Don't break anything!

SPEAKER_01: Your mother's not well.
Go now, for her sake.
SPEAKER_01: I'll look after her for a few days?
SPEAKER_01: Until you're set up elsewhere.
SPEAKER_01: Want me to help you?
SPEAKER_01: A rare visitor indeed.
SPEAKER_01: Master Fugui! It's been a year at least.
SPEAKER_01: This old home of yours is great.
SPEAKER_01: Warm in winter, cool in summer.
SPEAKER_01: Great at any price.
SPEAKER_01: I've given up the puppet troupe.
SPEAKER_01: Have a seat.

SPEAKER_01: I don't gamble anymore.
Don't want to end up like you.
SPEAKER_01: I'm not one to lend money.
SPEAKER_01: I'll lend you something else. More practical.
SPEAKER_01: Earn your money yourself.
SPEAKER_01: Put together a troupe.
SPEAKER_01: They are fabulous.
SPEAKER_01: My heart is full of sorrow
SPEAKER_01: Good idea.
SPEAKER_24: Come often. You're always welcome.

SPEAKER_24: I never had to beg
when I ran the puppet troupe.
SPEAKER_24: Big ambition for a little kid.
SPEAKER_24: It's more than enough.
SPEAKER_24: So gobble away. Help yourself to sauces.
SPEAKER_24: Youqing, I'll help you stir that up.
SPEAKER_24: What a big appetite!
SPEAKER_24: And so much chili sauce!
SPEAKER_08: Old Man Heaven
SPEAKER_08: Don't make it so late
SPEAKER_08: Me and my lover
SPEAKER_08: want more time
SPEAKER_08: To frolic in our great big bed
SPEAKER_08: Grandpa's cursing you again.

SPEAKER_08: - What are you doing?
- Master Fugui.
SPEAKER_08: Me and my lover want more time
SPEAKER_08: To frolic on our great big bed
SPEAKER_08: Come out!
SPEAKER_08: There's metal on it.
SPEAKER_08: He wouldn't come.
SPEAKER_08: Get Dr. Wang over here.
SPEAKER_08: What's wrong with him? What happened?
SPEAKER_08: Dr. Wang!

SPEAKER_08: - Feeling better?
- Not at all.
SPEAKER_08: The only child I have left.
SPEAKER_16: Master Fugui is going home. You take him.
SPEAKER_16: I am very sorry, but you've got nothing left.

SPEAKER_16: What could you stake the bet on?
We don't accept empty bets.
SPEAKER_16: Your wife's been waiting for ages.
SPEAKER_16: The wounded who froze to death.
SPEAKER_16: They've all run off.
SPEAKER_16: How could that be?
SPEAKER_16: So, no running?
SPEAKER_16: We must be going.
SPEAKER_16: Thanks, we'll go to the factory bathhouse.
SPEAKER_16: Chairman Mao...
SPEAKER_16: Comrade Fengxia's mine now.
SPEAKER_16: Do as Mommy says and push.
SPEAKER_16: Everything will be fine.
SPEAKER_16: We dragged him here today...
SPEAKER_16: to educate him, to criticize him...
SPEAKER_16: and to let him witness her giving birth.

SPEAKER_16: To show him the heirs
of this new, Red world.
SPEAKER_16: That's professor Wang...
SPEAKER_16: head of obstetrics.
SPEAKER_16: Dr. Wang, don't be afraid.
SPEAKER_16: Erxi, you're a lucky man!
SPEAKER_16: What's with him?
SPEAKER_16: He ate too quickly.
SPEAKER_16: It's okay.
SPEAKER_16: Not just buns...
SPEAKER_16: anything made from wheat.
SPEAKER_23: Take care.
SPEAKER_23: Take care, Master.
SPEAKER_23: Welcome home, sir.
SPEAKER_23: Dad!
SPEAKER_23: Degenerate! Another night gambling!
SPEAKER_23: If you're unhappy, talk to Mr. Xie.
SPEAKER_23: This can't be happening!
SPEAKER_23: Not that we'd accept it as ante.
SPEAKER_23: It's valuable. Don't scratch it. Take it slowly.
SPEAKER_23: It's Fugui's son?
SPEAKER_23: District Chief arrived after dark.

SPEAKER_23: He backed up,
and his jeep knocked the wall down.
SPEAKER_23: Youqing was sleeping on the other side.
SPEAKER_23: When the wall collapsed...
SPEAKER_23: he didn't have a chance.
SPEAKER_23: The District Chief was hurt, too.
SPEAKER_23: He hadn't slept for three days.
SPEAKER_23: Fugui, listen to me.

SPEAKER_23: We have to try and bear it,
even in the worst of times.
SPEAKER_23: Please come again.
SPEAKER_23: What do you think about Fengxia and me?
SPEAKER_23: They've been locked away.
SPEAKER_23: The Red Guards are in control!

SPEAKER_23: - Have a look.
- Not yet!
SPEAKER_23: Please, I'm the father!
SPEAKER_23: Is it a boy?
SPEAKER_23: Yes, 7.9 pounds!

SPEAKER_23: - How is he?
- They're both fine!
SPEAKER_12: A dog's gotta eat shit! Little bastard!
SPEAKER_12: If you don't stop...
SPEAKER_12: we'll lose the little we have.
SPEAKER_12: Aren't you capable of anything else?
SPEAKER_12: Of all you could have learned, bastard!
SPEAKER_12: Will you cut it out?

SPEAKER_12: - What'd he just say?
- Nothing. Eat.
SPEAKER_22: Is gambling all you know?
